title: Average value of a function on an interval

content.question: The function f is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>âˆ«</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4961@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the average rate of change of f over the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mo>]</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F00@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
